definition: to rest/to stop doing sth for a period of time/to cease/(imperative) don't
to chatter or jabber on and on
without stopping to sleep or have a rest (idiom)
don't do it, or don't rest (idiom); either give up, or go through to the end/Since we started, we must carry it through whatever happens./in for a penny, in for a pound
pinyin: yi1 bu4 zuo4 , er4 bu4 xiu1

definition: to fight to one's last gasp
to talk incessantly/to chatter on and on

sentences.english: That won't stop us from blathering on about it, of course.
sentences.chinese: 当然，这并不能阻止我们在这个问题上喋喋不休。

sentences.english: The school board members spend their time disputing and getting nothing done.
sentences.chinese: 学校董事们争论不休，但一事无成。

sentences.english: I wish she stop blabbering her boyfriend.
sentences.chinese: 我希望她停止碟碟不休地谈论她男朋友。

sentences.english: I didn't understand the chatter, almost as much as they.
sentences.chinese: 我不明白这喋喋不休的扯谈，他们也差不多如此。

sentences.english: Recently our classmates are arguing about if the students in Grade 3 in Senior High School should have self-studying classes at night.
sentences.chinese: 我班同学最近就高三学生是否应该上晚自习争论不休。

sentences.english: Her endless talking is really bothering me.
sentences.chinese: 她讲话喋喋不休真令我烦。

sentences.english: His wife kept on at him to buy her a new coat.
sentences.chinese: 他老婆喋喋不休地唠叨要他为她买一件新袄子。

sentences.english: Scholars still debate over the site’s intended use. (Eitan Abramovich/AFP/Getty Images/Life.com)
sentences.chinese: 学者们仍在为搞清楚这个地方的用途而争论不休。

sentences.english: The teacher harangued us all about our untidy work.
sentences.chinese: 老师对于凌乱的作业对我们全部喋喋不休地训斥。

sentences.english: Equivalence translation is one of the topics disputed about the translation theories.
sentences.chinese: 等值翻译是翻译理论界长期以来争论不休的话题之一。

sentences.english: She was burbling on her unemployment.
sentences.chinese: 她絮絮不休她的失业问题。

sentences.english: When I left he was still drivelling on about his popularity in school.
sentences.chinese: 当我离开时他还在喋喋不休地胡说他在学校的声望。

sentences.english: It was only a fancy; yet a fancy will sometimes be importunate.
sentences.chinese: 它只是一个幻梦，但是有时幻梦是会纠缠不休的。

sentences.english: Several goddesses argued over who was the most beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 众女神对于谁才是最美的女人争论不休。
他们因花费的事争吵不休。

sentences.english: Anthony wheedled. He badgered. He pouted. "Where would you get them?"
sentences.chinese: 安东尼开始花言巧语，继而纠缠不休，最后撅起了嘴。

definition: to arise again/to make a comeback/resurgence
to rage/to dash/to surge/also written 激盪|激荡
to spring up everywhere/from all around
at a stalemate/deadlocked/in unrelenting mutual opposition
to roll over and over (of billows or clouds)

up here, down there (idiom); to rise and fall in succession/no sooner one subsides, the next arises/repeating continuously/occurring again and again (of applause, fires, waves, protests, conflicts, uprisings etc)
